title: What If The Randomness Of The Item System Got Removed?
body:
Simply:

* For each minion killed, you would receive golds
* Using the golds, you could buy items, just like in Summoner's Rift

The result:

* The TFT would be less luck-dependent (hence, fairer)
* The TFT would include more strategy (spending golds on items vs rerolls vs leveling)
* Unlike the solution to set the number of dropped items to a fixed number, this solution creates more versatile gameplay

replies.body:
There are a couple reasons to keep items random:
1. It keeps there from being a stale meta, as you can't control what you buy
2. It keeps a measure of thinking on your feet, as you're bombarded with new situations of having to figure out what items to build given the current situation and items given, rather than a planned measure that you simply work toward
3. It gives you a gambler's desire to keep playing until you get the "plenteous perfect items" high.  This is a terrible reason, but it does directly make the game addictive (even if less fun and less skill based).
4. On average over hundreds of games, the bad luck you get will be canceled out by the good luck, and your rank will reflect the way you can handle both advantageous and disadvantageous situations on the fly, rather than purely planned teams before the match begins.

Though the number of items you get should CERTAINLY be more regularized, because everyone's tired of fighting 6 items with only 2...

1. Don't understand that. You would still have to build items depending on your champions combo which depends on champions that you choose from random rolls.
2. That is true. However, when you are already forced into building certain champions combo (because the RNG rolls forced you to), you depend on certain items drop that synergizes with that combo. If you get shit items, you are in a disadvantage compared to your opponents.
3. Again, this is already secured by champions being randomized.
4. This is also true. But this point also applies to summoner's rift rankeds -- theoretically, there's no need to create a system that would protect you from losing LP if you have an afk teammate. If you play many games, and you never leave, you will actually benefit from people going afk (5 potential enemy leavers vs 4 potential teammate leavers). However, it still feels terrible to lose LP like that, and the system should be there.

1-2-3) But people would quickly find out the optimal items for every team composition they are building and it would quickly devolve into who rolled the better champions, which would be even more frustrating. 

Having randomness to what items you get forces you to switch up strategies dynamically far more than if you could just build whatever items you wanted based on what champions you are offered.

4) You keep comparing it to Summoner's Rift, but it's a bad comparison. The only real thing they have in common is the champions and one ability. 

Auto Chess games completely take away control of individual champions, so you NEED to have other hard choices like what items to get based on what is available and what you have already gotten and if you should stick with your champions based on what you have been offered.

If this where a thing then they would have to remove spatula. or make it so expensive its useless.

If they didn't you could:
1. Spam FoN and fill your side completely with champions.
2. Have 6 Assassins all with Knight/Glacier/Sorcerer.
Then champion rolls will be the next big complaint.

Now the most "OP" items come at a steep price and you have the option to go for a cheaper, safer option if you want.
